original: Dahl, Einar Vilhelm Robert, folkskollärare, Uddevalla, f. 1/3/04 i Falun av stadsvaktmäst. Axel D. o. Signe Sten. G. 31 m. Maja Lundberg. Barn: Marianne f. 34, Jan 37. — Stud:ex. i Falun 24, folksk :lär :ex. i Karlstad 26. Föret. stud:res. t. uti. Folksk :lär. i Uddevalla sed. 27. Led. av stads-fuillm. (s) sed. 31, ordf. i dess beredn:-utsk., sekr. i direkt, f. Gustafsbergs barnhus, led. av styr. f. Max Alb. Dahlgrens barnhem f. flickor, landstingsman sed. 38, ordf. i Bohusl. distr. av SAP, ordf. i Uddevalla ungd:råd, ordf. i styr. f. Folkets Hus o. Idr:-hallen, led. av komm. f. Internacia Esperanto Ligo. Skr.: Lärobok i Esperanto f. skolan, teaterpjäser f. barn o. ungd. m. fl.
translated: Dahl, Einar Vilhelm Robert, people's school teacher, from Uddevalla, born on March 1, 1904 in Falun to city police constable Axel D. and Signe Sten. Married in 1931 to Maja Lundberg. Children: Marianne born in 1934, Jan born in 1937. He took his final exams in Falun in 1924 and his people's school teacher's exams in Karlstad in 1926. Undertook study trips abroad. He worked as a people's school teacher in Uddevalla from 1927. He was a member of the city council since 1931, chairman of its preparatory committee, secretary of the board of Gustafsberg's children's home, member of the board of Max Alb. Dahlgren's girls' home, county council member since 1938, chairman of Bohuslän's district of the Social Democratic Party, chairman of the Uddevalla youth council, chairman of the board of Folkets Hus and Idr:-hallen, member of the committee for the International Esperanto League. He wrote a textbook in Esperanto for schools, plays for children and young people, and more.

structured.description: Einar Vilhelm Robert Dahl was a Swedish people's school teacher from Uddevalla. He was born on March 1, 1904 in Falun to city police constable Axel D. and Signe Sten. He was married in 1931 to Maja Lundberg, and had two children - Marianne and Jan. He took his final exams in Falun in 1924 and his people's school teacher's exams in Karlstad in 1926. He worked as a people's school teacher in Uddevalla from 1927. He was a member of the city council since 1931, chairman of its preparatory committee, secretary of the board of Gustafsberg's children's home, member of the board of Max Alb. Dahlgren's girls' home, county council member since 1938, chairman of Bohuslän's district of the Social Democratic Party, chairman of the Uddevalla youth council, chairman of the board of Folkets Hus and Idr:-hallen, member of the committee for the International Esperanto League. He wrote a textbook in Esperanto for schools, plays for children and young people, and more.
